title: Frank Lampard and Jody Morris urged senior players including Willian and Pedro to step up
text:
Chelsea’s reaction to back-to-back defeats by Valencia then Liverpool comes after Frank Lampard and his assistant Jody Morris strategically put pressure on their senior players.

The pair called on the more experienced members of their squad, including Willian and Pedro, to step up and stop leaving it to the youngsters to secure wins.

Since those meetings, in which both Lampard and Morris aired their frustrations, Chelsea have clinched four successive wins in all competitions — scoring 15 goals and conceding just three.

Frank Lampard and his assistant Jody Morris strategically put pressure on their senior players

The pair called on the more experienced members of their squad, including Willian and Pedro

Willian, Pedro, Michy Batshuayi and Ross Barkley have all got off the mark for the season since Chelsea’s hard-fought 2-1 home loss to Liverpool on September 22.

The Blues bosses feel they cannot rely on their young guns alone if they are to finish inside the top four. That is despite Tammy Abraham and Mason Mount’s blistering starts.

Lampard wants his established stars to pull their weight, too. Olivier Giroud has not had much of an opportunity, however, with the prolific Abraham keeping him out of the team.

Abraham, their 22-year-old centre forward, is the club’s top scorer on nine goals. He is then followed by 20-year-old Mount on four. Both are now away on England duty.

Fikayo Tomori, the 21-year-old defender, was also called up by Three Lions boss Gareth Southgate.

Since losing to Liverpool, Chelsea have secured four impressive wins. They beat Grimsby 7-1 in the Carabao Cup, then Brighton 2-0 in the Premier League, Lille 2-1 in the Champions League and Southampton 4-1 in the top flight.

Newcastle visit Stamford Bridge next on October 19. Chelsea currently sit fifth in the table, two points shy of Manchester City in second.
